description:
Holy Kitchen is a small, intimate restaurant serving home-cooked Indian food. I was there on Sunday for brunch and was surprised to find the restaurant mostly empty. They apparently do a brisk takeout business. My date and I enjoyed having the place to ourselves. It's a great spot for a quiet date.

We ordered samosas, chana masala, gobi mattar (not on the menu but they'll make it), and roti. I had the chai, which comes with free refills.

The food came out quickly and was delicious. I like the home-cooking style of cooking. Some Indian restaurants put too much fat and oil into the dishes. Here, you feel like your mother is cooking for you. Oh, and the prices are totally reasonable!
author: Joshua W.

description:
Some people are creatures of habit. My coworker always gets the butter chicken, garlic naan, and samosas, without fail. He's also in the office every weekend, but that's another story....

I got the spinach paneer and a white basmati rice. Overall the taste was ok, but a bit less flavorful and rich than some of the other spots I've had. The spinach paneer was less oily (which I appreciated!) but the cheese was sort of rubbery and the spinach was watery. The rice was pretty standard.

It was pretty standard-- I'd try something else next time, but my coworkers clearly come back (and one of them is Indian, so hey what do I know).
author: Nicole H.

description:
Got delivery from here and was pretty satisfied with the order. Got vegetable korma, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and basmati rice. Didn't know what korma was when I ordered it and wasn't into the super creamy taste but my boyfriend thought it was good. I thought the tikka masala was pretty good with a decent amount of chicken. I got the medium spicy and it wasn't spicy at all, so I would recommend getting one level higher of spiciness to add a little more flavor to it. 

The naan was good but pretty rubbery at that point since it was wrapped up in foil the entire way. I bet if I ate it there at the restaurant it would have been really good.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. A sister restaurant to the famous Little Delhi downtown, the chef said he spends more time here because it's quieter and the food quality speaks to this. Oh not to mention, this is a very affordable meal. 

Chicken Tike Masalaa is our go to (with basmati rice and garlic naan) but every other dish we have had has been phenomenal. 

Very attentive service, and the owners will sometimes check in which is very nice.

My recommendation to the management - some music would really help the ambiance. It does feel a little stiff in here sometimes.
author: Miranda M.

description: Disgusting food with no flavor, we had huge insect in the dish. Dirty and nasty place, avoid at all circumstances. When we informed the issue to the restaurant manager he didn't do anything, said sorry and left. We left our food and the restaurant, never coming back. Horrible and disgusting Indian restaurant
author: Himika R.

description:
Just when I was losing hope on finding great Indian food in this city, I came across Holy Kitchen. And.It.Was.EVERYTHING! I'm used to homemade Indian food, and this was definitely a close second.

This place is on the small, intimate side, if you know what I mean. A little gem in the heart of Noe Valley. Great place to check out for a quick lunch or dinner date (or just because, since their food is delicious!) One of the best things about this place is the Naan: cooked nice and buttery and to perfection. They also have Poori (a wheat bread) which has been hard for me to find.

The flavors are delicious however if you are one for spice, I would say this isn't too spicy ( which is great for me, but if you love that spicy kick, you just may be disappointed). I don't mind though, because I love flavor and not necessarily a lot of kick. 

Too many dishes to name that were delicious: the Shrimp Biryani, Fish Curry, Aloo Gobi, Mattar Paneer to name a few. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything here! Not to mention, service is fantastic!

And kudos for being able to fit not one but TWO strollers in this place (one being a double stroller at that).
author: Tracy T.

description:
O. M. G. The garlic naan! If you visit this place you'll have to get it. 

My friend and I are in SF for a weekend and we tried this place for dinner. We got the garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, badami chicken, and of course a side of white rice. Everything was cooked to perfection. Honestly, the chicken fell apart on the plate when we cut into the pieces. We have never tried or heard of the badami chicken before. It was very tasty. Let just say I'm excited for the left over. 

The service was super sweet but a tad bit slow. Maybe they are just really relaxed there?
author: Suthida K.

description:
We ordered delivery from here, and frankly, were not impressed.  The food was average, the delivery (via Yelp) came a few minutes before the ETA (nice), but the delivery person left quickly without taking payment (which necessitated a call to the restaurant).

We ordered the following dishes and were not wowed by any of them:

1) Chicken biriyani - disappointing - the chicken was a bit dry, and the dish had too much going on (too many cashews, for example)
2) Lamb saag - ok, nothing special
3) Okra - ok
4) Daal tadka - mediocre 
5) Naan - ok

The delivery came a bit early, which was great, but the delivery person hurried away as my husband went to grab his wallet to pay cash (as we'd specified on our order).  We then had to call the restaurant to give them our credit card info to make sure they got paid, which was a slightly irritating added step.

Overall, we were underwhelmed and will not be hurrying back.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Holy Kitchen was recommended to us by our Indian hosts so we knew it had to be good. The papadum was sooo good. The large, crispy crackers were so flavorful I could have just eaten them for my whole meal. The samosas were also excellent. I had the chicken soup and it was well-seasoned. The chicken meat was a tad bit dry though. The garlic naan was excellent. The other dishes I tried were delicious.  

We were the first ones here for Sunday brunch and the server was very friendly and accommodating. I'm glad we ate here instead of braving the long brunch lines.
author: Thien H.

description: Ordered delivery via Yelp and food was delivered on-time, organized neatly in the bag and labelled clearly.  The food was excellent!  I've been in the restaurant before and enjoyed the meal - the restaurant is clean, service is attentive and food was delicious.  I've been tried many Indian restaurants in SF, and HK is one of the best.  The delivery service was definitely on par to the in-restaurant dining experience.  I ordered the Butter Chicken for my husband, Tangdi Kabab for my 10-year old son, and Chana Masala for myself.  My husband said the Butter Chicken was really good and that I was awesome to order it - 5 stars to the Butter Chicken of Love, lol.  The chicken drumstick dish I ordered for my son was seasoned just right - not too spicy, yet tasty, which is perfect for my picky 10-year old son.  I recently became a pescatarian and the Chana Masala was an excellent choice for me - super satisfying.  Will definitely order from HK again when I'm too lazy to get to the restaurant!
author: michele g.

description: Excellent!  I haven't seen any reviews mention the badami chicken--this has become my favorite. Highly advised.
author: Ted M.

description:
Ordered a bunch of entrees for delivery. Cockroach in my food. Enough said. 







So disgusting. Never again.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Wow! Just wow!

It was late on a Tuesday. I was tired and didn't feel like cooking. I looked for places not too far from my sublet and stumbled on this place. Did I say wow?

I come from the TL - where folks come from all over for the Indian food. Who knew the Mission is where it's at? 

Everything was a notch above the standard. The flavors in each dish were unique and I could taste each one separately - instead of everything ending up as a blur in my mouth. It also tasted fresh and less greasy than typical Indian fare. Really, really good.
author: Kim C.

description:
Not too shabby for a Friday night dinner. My BF and I decided to order delivery from Holy Kitchen. 

What we ordered: butter chicken, shrimp curry, garlic naan, plain naan, and mango lassi

What we liked: They don't skimp on the meat. The mango lassi tasted more tart than most. 

What we disliked: The shrimp curry tasted like spicy tomato soup.  

Would i order it again: meh..
author: Briana H.

description: This place is so good. The price, the food, the service. Great neighborhood spot that we can always count on, and never a wait. Our favorite is the pistachio curry but we also love the tikka masala, butter chicken, Malai shrimp curry, and always get the garlic naan!
author: Shabnam E.

description:
I love this neighborhood Indian restaurant; it's one of my go-to and casual favorites. I've been happy with everything I've ordered, but am typically in a chicken tikka masala habit. 

Many order food to go, but the service if you eat at the restaurant is good.
author: Wendy J.

description: when dinner takes 2.5hrs to get delivered, it must be holy kitchen. what i didn't appreciate was management lying about when the order left. then they would not let me cancel the order. good riddance!!
author: Julie L.

description:
We stopped in here for lunch today after intending to try it for the past few months. We came in at the tail-end of lunch service before they close in the middle of the day. Holy Kitchen offers lunch specials, even on the weekend, which is a plus.

Both of us got the lunch specials, which are definitely the way to go. Mine was $8.99 for mixed veggies, dal, a side salad, rice and roti. His was $9.99 for Chicken Tikka Masala, Dal, a side salad, rice and Naan. Both of us ordered ours spicy. We were brought Papadum to start, which is always good. The food arrived quickly and the portion was MASSIVE. I left 3/4 of my rice and 1/2 of my Roti, and trust me guys, I can eat.  The food was clearly fresh and everything was pretty good. My main complaint was that there wasn't enough spice, especially for ordering something "spicy". Sticking some dried chilis in Dal does not count. Plus the Roti was a bit meh and the Naan was not much better. I also did not really appreciate how the mixed vegetable entree wasn't advertised with Paneer. Personally, I avoid Paneer and would not have ordered it had I known.

I would definitely come back, but probably for dinner when we can try more of their menu. The prices on the dinner menu were quite reasonable and I am sure we will be back because it is so close.
author: Carrie W.

description: Really bad food, unfortunately. Pleasant staff but not crowded with customers, which seems to have put the place in a bad spiral: the papadums had been cooked hours ago, the saag paneer had been sitting for hours, basically everything at dinner tasted like bland leftovers from an uneaten lunch buffet.
author: tw s.

description: Favorite spot in Noe for saag paneer and butter chicken. The butter chicken tastes rich but never oily. They are fast, reasonable, and delicious. Have done a mix of pickup and dine in with Allset and don't think I've ever waited more than 1/2 hour - I don't know how they do it!
author: Kyle D.

description:
I'm impulsively writing a review for this neighborhood gem because I just finished a dinner my husband brought home and it was a darn good meal! Sure, I'd been there before, but something about the baingan barta, okra dish, onion nan and flavored rice just hit the spot tonight. 

I seriously feel high from eating this delicious food, but I am stone cold sober! 

The dine in experience is nice too. Seems like the atmosphere is usually calm with a few wine and beer selections to complement your dish. 

Thank you for the satisfying meal Holy Kitchen!
author: Regina L.

description:
Holy Kitchen has been on my list of new ( to me ) Indian places to try & we are ever-seeking our takeout nirvana.  Ordered the following:

Sahi Paneer - cheese & cashews in creamy sauce - this was a newish dish for us but have to say it tasted almost the same as the other items we'd selected - not that that's a bad thing!

Mattar Paneer - this is 1 of Sis' go-to items & she was happily pleased with the creamy cheese cubes & peas

Mali Kofta - these dumplings were definitely homemade & still had whole spice pods in the mix

Vegetable Korma - veggies in a creamy tomato sauce - again the flavors were very similar to what we'd ordered above.....maybe it's b/c all the dishes we'd ordered said some version of "creamy sauce"??

Also to note: we'd asked for super spicy but there was barely any heat - lots of flavor but barely any heat.  Maybe next time we'll ask for "Indian spicy" or something to convey we do not want the "American" version of spicy - we actually mean bring on the heat!

Samosa - the veggies were smashed together like maybe they'd been fried for too long & the outer shell almost tasted a little like chicken - although don't hold me to that

Mango Lassi - incredibly creamy & flavorful!

So have to say this was a good start for us & we'd come back & that has to make us fans
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I ordered paneer tikka masala with a garlic naan for pickup.


Sorry to say, really nothing special. PTM was extremely basic. The naan was too doughy.
author: Shruti D.

description: Very good service large portions.  the food we ordered had lots of tomatoes which we didn't know.  We told them mild on spiciness and it was bland, our fault.  Order food with some spice.  We'll be back to try again.
author: Kent P.

description: Used to love this place but my gf experienced food poisoning recently. We called and they said we'd receive a $20 credit. Okay, that was acceptable. Called up to order and they changed it to 20%, backtracking on their original promise. So... watch out for the food poisoning if you order any lamb dishes from here!
author: Christian H.

description:
Chicken tikka masala lovers, I highly recommend you change it up a bit and try their chicken korma (I order spicy medium), or even swap out the chicken for paneer. Your eyes will be rolling in the back of your head and this dish will be like a song on repeat for the remainder of your days. I've tried a fair amount of kormas in the city and this has the best balance of creaminess, texture, and tanginess from the tomatoes, plus the chicken is generally never too dry.

Their chicken tikka masala is not my favorite in the city, but in addition to the korma, their appetizers such as samosas and aloo tikki are rivaled by none.

This place doesn't get much foot traffic though it has a cute atmosphere. I've ordered delivery a fair amount as well, and neither disappoint.
author: Steph L.

description:
I drove all the way from sunset and was honestly disappointed. I found this place after craving for some Gobi Manchurian and this place was the first result on Yelp.

I ordered the Gobi Manchurian, chilli chicken and chicken biryani. The Gobi Manchurian was sweet. I've never had sweet Gobi Manchurian so it threw me off right away. The biriyani rice was too oily. The only saving grace was the chilli chicken which I enjoyed and was kinda spicy (good).
author: Ruben M.

description:
Great neighborhood Indian restaurant.

Lunch specials are amazing.  For $9.99 you can get a bowl of chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi or Dal Saag, rice, naan, and salad.  If you're a vegetarian, your combo is only $8.99.  What an amazing deal.  There was a ton of food and it started with a plate of 3 papadum to start.  Even though there's a set lunch special, they do let you substitute sometimes, depending on what it is, so doesn't hurt to ask if your favorite dish isn't on the menu.  The salad dressing is enjoyable too.

Dinner is a little more expensive and all ala carte.

Mango lassi isn't my favorite and it's not served that cold. It's a little more on the yogurt side and less on the mango flavor side.

Friendly service.

Cash, credit, or multiple ordering services for takeout and delivery.

Street parking on 24th (some parking is free!) or around the corner on Diamond is usually easier parking than towards Castro street.
author: Traci H.

description: I had a great experience with Holy Kitchen on my first try! My roommates and I ordered through the Yelp app and ordered the Chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, lamb tika masala, spinach paneer, garlic naan and basmati rice. For mild spice, butter chicken is my favorite, but all of them were delicious. The naan was a little bit more chewy than I usually have, but still delicious. Price wise, it's a little pricey for the portion size, but still delicious AND delivery was in like 30 minutes which is unheard of. Will definitely order again!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
I've dined at many of the Indian restaurants in SF. I think this place has the best Chicken Tikka Masala (aka butter chicken) and Chicken Korma in the city. Hands down. The staff is always courteous and nice too. And the Naan is wonderful. 

Worth a trip. I think you'll be happy with your meal.
author: Marcus L.

description:
Ordered an on-line meal delivery which never came. Got charged anyway. They told me it was ordered for pick-up. Then they offered to deliver the meal but said it had been sitting there for a while.

I used to eat there a lot. But no more.
author: Gary L.

description: Impressive Indian food gets the classics right, and Holy Kitchen does exactly that. Good for both dine in and delivery.
author: Vishay N.

description: Best Indian food ever. They made moist rice in biryani and medium spicy as I wanted. Samosa was awesome too. Really enjoyed it. Delivery guy was nice too. Would love to visit there for more. Yum yum yummy lol
author: Ramesh A.

description:
Holy Kitchen is great! We live just up the street and it is our go-to for a night in. The portions are generous, prices are completely reasonable, and we have yet to have a bad dish. The papdi chat and mattar paneer are particular favorites. 

I've never eaten in the restaurant itself so I can't speak to their table service, but I've always been greeted with a smile and pleasant conversation when I go to pick food up. If you find yourself in Noe Valley, definitely give it a try.
author: Andrew J.

description: I love this place.  The food is always fresh and very tasty.  Many Northern Indian restaurants, I feel, use a lot of oil and spices in their food, but not this place.  I also love it how when you ask for the food to be made mild, it is!  The lunch specials, especially, are a great deal, and suffice for two meals for me.
author: Rango K.

description:
Some of the best indian food in this city!! I'll admit I haven't actually eaten at the restaurant but I've ordered delivery a few times and have never been disappointed. We ordered through uber eats and the app will ask for level of spiciness for each dish ordered. I've ordered the paneer makhani, mutter paneer, and butter chicken all at spicy. The spicy is true to it's name! This is the only indian restaurant that I have ever eaten at that when I order spicy, I actually get indian spicy. Most other restaurants give a little spice but never enough. I find myself so disappointed each time, but this restaurant did it right. The spiciness is perfect and full of flavor. This is my new favorite indian delivery spot and love that's so close to my house. I do wish the rice came with the order with delivery but that seems to be a thing with all indian restaurants in this city. 

The limited service I have experienced with this restaurant is also amazing. I left a note in my uber eat order about my cashew allergy and they actually read it and adjusted my order as I asked. Thank you so much!
author: Lisa D.

description:
I've only ever eaten Holy Kitchen vis-à-vis delivery, but it has quickly become my favorite Indian food in SF. 

Delivery so far has been a breeze - you can order from Holy Kitchen through Seamless until 8:45pm (no fee), Uber Eats until 9:00pm (fee, don't recall what), and Door Dash until 9:15pm ($4.95 fee).  They typically quote a delivery time of about 45-60 minutes, but I've never waited longer than half an hour.  And, my food always arrives piping hot.  Maybe even uncomfortably so.  A++

The food is awesome and incredibly flavorful.  It's never oversalted or overcooked or gummy or fatty or any of the other bad adjectives that you could use to describe food.  The garlic naan is awesome and always arrives warm and soft.  I've never actually had garlic naan that's so tasty - I normally feel like it barely tastes of garlic, but this is like woah (without being gross or leaving you feeling like you could ward off vampires).  The chicken rezala is super tasty and I love to dip my naan in it.  So is the chana masala and lamb vindaloo.  The fish curry was also quite nice - they used salmon, which was a little weird, but I also liked that I didn't feel as though I was eating mystery fish.  The only thing I haven't loved was the chicken soup - it's just chicken, peas, and broth...and it tastes really overwhelmingly of peas.

Please note that this place doesn't provide rice for free with its entrees.  You have to order it on the side, or order naan and use that instead (which is what I do).

I'll definitely be ordering this on the regular!
author: Tay H.

description: I love ordering food from this place. Some of the best Indian food I've had in the city, and the service is great as well. The staff is always very friendly and attentive. The lamb achari is delicious and the garlic naan is wonderful. Prices are reasonable and the portions are large. I'd highly recommend Holy Kitchen - it's a great Noe Valley gem.
author: Stuart B.

description:
A nice Indian place in Noe Valley with good ambience, generous portions and good service. My wife doesn't do spicy, so the mild was perfect for her, but I can't speak to their spiciness levels. We would come back again! Parking was ok in this area, and the place wasn't too busy on a Friday night.

The lamb curry was good - the lamb was tender and the sauce was flavorful. The butter chicken was good too, but a bit sour. The naans were excellent.
author: Tim S.

description:
This is a disgrace to Indian cuisine. I know because I am south Asian. We ordered chicken tikka masala, vegetable korma, house salad with chicken soup. 
The dressing was okay but everything else was not even close to Indian food. The vegetable corma was not even spicy even though we asked. It was less than mild. 
Non of the chicken were seasoned. The tikka masala was unbalanced. 
I hate it when an Indian place don't offer you rice even though most Asian dishes comes with rice.
author: Ashib R.

description: I came here for the first time and freaking blown away!!!! Im from Colorado and I think we have really good Indian there but good god this might be the best Indian food I've ever had! Nice vibe super friendly staff and some of the best naan and tika massala I've had in my life. Awesome spot. Super recommend
author: Chaz C.

description: First time here on a whim driving down 24th St. and found this restaurant open New Years Eve. Wonderful!  We ordered curry of which there are many kinds, the corn chat salad, mango lassis and garlic naan. Oh my. So delicious. The feeling in the restaurant is kind and the music was sublime. We'll be back!
author: Robert K.

description:
I've tried a bunch of different options for Indian delivery in SF, and Holy Kitchen is by far the best I've found. Their chicken tikka masala may be the tastiest I've had in SF. I also really like their chana masala and lamb achari. And unlike a lot of delivery places, they're consistent--if you liked something the last time you had it, you'll probably like it next time, too.

Also, Holy Kitchen's naan is unusually flavorful. They charge a bit more than I'd like for rice, but they do at least give you a generous portion.

On top of all that, they deliver at the speed of light, and their delivery people are very courteous. One time I was accidentally given the wrong order, but the folks at Holy Kitchen practically scrambled fighter jets and sent out the National Guard to fix things as quickly as possible.

If you're looking for tasty Indian food, give Holy Kitchen a try.
author: Jeff W.

description: We were exhausted and needed takeout. The food was ready quickly which was great. The vegetable biryani was delicious, chicken korma was fine, but the fish tandoori was totally overlooked. It seemed expensive ($50) but then we had leftovers for a second meal so price became reasonable.
author: Carol R.

description:
Very solid Indian food. I decided to get the Badami Chicken based on a review here, as well as the Butter Chicken. As other reviewers noted, the Butter Chicken is a bit more tomato-y than some places, but it is soooo savory and delicious. The Badami chicken is also mouth-watering, and really creamy yellowy chicken dish where the spices are more subtle than many Indian dishes. I'm used to Indian flavors smacking me upside the head, and while I also love that, this was a great experience with something a little more benign. 

I'll gladly order again, but not /all the time/ due to prices.

The super delicious food would earn them 5 stars, but by the time you add naan and rice, you're over $20 for dinner...it caused my eyebrows to raise, especially for the neighborhood it's in, though the portions are at least hearty.
author: Chris S.

description: This is my new favorite lunch delivery! Excellent vegetarian options with fluffy garlic naan! The bengan bharta (eggplant) and saag paneer is not to be missed!
author: Laura M.

description: Great comfort Indian food. Pleasant service and decent drink selection. Go here at least once per week.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Disclaimer: 
I'm Indian.

While I consider myself culinarily fortunate to have grown up w homemade roti, puri, dal, & a rotation of lamb, chicken, salmon, & crab curries (I refused to eat goat, mutton, pigeon, spinach, & most other vegetables.  You know kids).  And forget about samosas & the desserts my grandmother used to make for me.  I was thoroughly spoiled.  

It naturally makes it difficult for me to eat in Indian restaurants.

But on a sleepy stay at home night, I wanted Indian, & I wanted delivery, & Holy Kitchen looked promising.

Since this was my first experience w them, & my man has had limited exposure to Indian food, I was conservative & went w staples.

Samosas to start.  Lamb achari, chicken curry, & basmati rice for the mains.  And garlic naan for our bread group.

The samosas were enormous.  They were tasty enough.  But bigger isn't always better.

The lamb achari was our favorite dish; the sauce was fragrant & delicious.  We asked for spicy, & this delivered.  The heat wasn't overbearing, but made its presence known.  Only, I wasn't wowed by the flavor of the meat.  Good lamb shouldn't taste gamey.  Ever.  

Having read & seen that their butter chicken is too tomatoey (it shouldn't be, plus, my heart belongs to Amber India for butter chicken), I went w the chicken curry instead.  One of my favorite dishes, I think you can measure how good an Indian restaurant is by how good their chicken curry is.  Indian curry is not like Thai or Japanese curry.  This was disappointing.  Very mediocre.  Pass.

Disclaimer:
You shouldn't order chicken curry when you make a kick-ass version yourself...& so does your mom.

The garlic naan...
It had a good degree of garlic & it did satisfy the garlic craving.  But it was on the thick & doughy side.  Naan is not supposed to be focaccia.

The basmati rice was great.  Cooked to perfection.

The mango lassi was not bad.  A touch tart, but not bad (again, Amber India makes a great one).  They do a house "lemon water," aka lemonade.  My man loved it.

Overall, not bad.  Props for not being oily, & for delivering in an hour, as promised.

Yes, I'm picky.  But there are so many better options in SF for Indian.  

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: This place is a little gem. Went for lunch and had one of the lunch specials, chicken with chick peas, rice and vegetables, they were amazing. My favorite were the chick peas, I would go back just to eat them again. The naan was delicious too, soft and a bit sweet. The price was very reasonable and the serving are generous. Will be going back to this place.
author: Lorely G.

description: Me and my partner have been coming to Holy Kitchen after being charmed by their delicious food and flavors! All their dishes seemed delicious but we decided to try something different out of their Chicken Tikka Masala dish we would usually have. We adventured to the Badami Chicken, with cashew and pistachio paste, and the delicious Peas Pilau rice. Awesome! We can't wait to be back!
author: Augusto O.

description:
I have traveled far and wide through India in search of delicious food, and gladly found this place that hits the mark in my own neighborhood. 

We had the chicken tikka masala and aloo gobi; both portions were generous and well prepared. Spices were distinct; ingredients were fresh. Naan was spot on perfect: fluffy crusty warm goodness.

Excellent food for a very honest price. Service was superb and the place is warm, friendly, and super clean. Certainly the best deal in Noe Valley and most likely the best food in the neighborhood as well. Worth the trip. Go for a relaxed, delicious, authentic Indian meal.
author: Ronco B.

description:
I want to give Holy Kitchen four stars, I really do. The fact that spicy meant spicy on my eat24 order means a lot! I was NOT expecting that and I was pleasantly surprised. Also the chicken in my tikka masala was tender, though the sauce was a little on the tomato-ey side.

But I have a nut to pick with them, specifically a cashew. What the hell were cashews doing in my peas pulao?! The menu doesn't specify they are mixed in, and what the hell are you doing mixing in the freakin cashews?! I couldn't even pick them out! Please for the love of hating cashews specify that you are adding nuts to things on the menu, for those of us who hate them (not to mention those deathly allergic). 

I will order again. But no more (never more) cashews.
author: Archana P.

description: Food here is pretty good. Lunch special is a good value.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Service is very attentive and the food is sooooo good. This is now the second time that I have eaten here and have gotten the same great quality (food and service). And nothing beats the still HOT out of the oven naan!

If there is only one thing to be critical about it's the spice level. "Medium" spicy is not really spicy. So if you genuinely like things on the spicy side, go with a higher spice level (or ask for it "medium...but authentic Indian medium, not American medium").

With that being said, even though my dish wasn't as spicy as I would like, it's still incredibly flavorful (and maybe I'm secretly a little happy that the dish was on the "mild" side rather than "too hot"). And frankly, even if I never get served a dish here that is as spicy as I would want it--I would still be happy every time.
author: Sarah C.

description: Great service, great food!! Very clean restaurant, nothing to complain! Awesome lunch deal!! Thank you! We'll be back!
author: Mino M.

description: Extremely good food.  Some of the best chicken TM i have ever had!  Awesome service too
author: Michael K.

description:
We came here on a Friday night, and most people seemed to be ordering take out or delivery. The restaurant itself wasn't super crowded, but severely understaffed. There were just 2 women frantically taking orders, clearing tables and taking care of the take out orders. They took our order quickly enough, but we ended up having to wait 45 minutes to actually get our food. I think take out is the way to go with this place. The decor is a bit off, and depressing. 

We ordered the lamb shish kabob, Chana masala, roti and naan. The shish kabob was really good. The lamb wasn't smelly at all, and it came out on one of those sizzling plates you sometimes see with fajitas. The chana masala was pretty standard, but way too spicy. I'm used to spicy food and prefer it, but this was almost too difficult to eat. I wish they at least gave some raita on the side. The roti and naan were delicious--not slathered in butter or hard at all. 

Sorry, there are no pictures because I was way too hungry.
author: Trena M.

description: Ordered through their website, but got a call twenty minutes later saying they do not deliver before 5pm. The guy asked me to come pick up the food myself, but when I got home and opened my food there was a hair in the rice. Definitely not my own, and the food was bland.
author: Katelin V.

description: Loved this place before I was vegan and love it even MORE now that I am vegan!!! Sooooo so good. They were super accommodating to my new change with food and answered every question. Place is awesome! Definitely recommend this to all people! :) pro e is super reasonable too
author: Monica L.

description:
Ordered delivery. Service was prompt and order was correct. We were excited to try Holy Kitchen due to reviews. Ordered sag paneer, tandoori fish, corn chaat and garlic nan. 

Good quality ingredients but bland. No flavor at all. Never had to break out the salt shaker and spices for Indian food before. 

Usually look forward to leftovers but not this time. Possibly it was an off night for the restaurant but it'll be awhile before we try this place again.
author: Mona M.

description:
I've always ordered delivery from this place!

My boyfriend was in town for the holidays and so I decided that we should give it a try and dine-in.

We ordered samosas, chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, chicken tandoori, garlic naan, and rice. Everything we ordered was pretty damn good.

If you order in, order pickup or delivery. The food is still good!

I suggest giving this place a try, if you haven't already.
author: PK R.

description:
Hot fluffy naan dipped into spicy Lamb Achari with pickled spices is my new favorite delivery treat.

I haven't eaten Indian food in a long while, but when some friends decided to splurge on some Holy Kitchen - I was intrigued. Each of my friends' dishes smelled amazing, the portions were generous, and the food wasn't swimming in grease.

And so - the other day when I was craving something hearty - I ordered Holy Kitchen.

The Achari sauce was bursting with flavor, the lamb was perfectly cooked, and the naan was absolutely dreamy. Even their basmati rice was phenomenal.

If you're looking for some quality Indian food in the city - look no further than Holy Kitchen. You can tell that they're intent on having repeat customers  - in the way they package their orders, as well as the quality ingredients that they use.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
We were excited to try holy kitchen because of the great reviews - but sadly left quite disappointed. The butter chicken, while flavorful barely had any chicken in it!! At one point we were literally fishing through it trying to find tiny shredded pieces of chicken.

The channa masala was OK but super salty. The chick peas weren't properly cooked all the way either (we didn't eat more than half of it). The samosas seemed like they came out of a frozen bag. The price point was fine ($60 for 2 people including 2 glasses of wine) but I've had far better Indian food elsewhere (like Viva Goa near cow hollow). The service was good, I just wished the food lived up to the hype!

Sadly, we will not be returning to this place.
author: Marcel C.

description:
Was craving Indian food, and while it isn't my favorite Indian place ever, it's pretty good!

Definitely get the samosas as an appetizer--so good and flavorful, and it's served with some sort of sauce that definitely complemented it. We ordered the butter chicken, and while it's not as buttery as I'm used to, it was a decent portion that served two. (I would say each order of curry serves too--if you're really hungry, consider ordered more than one curry dish).

What sold it for me was the garlic naan--wow, was it super garlic-y, fluffy, and delicious. I could've probably eaten more than I did.

It wasn't busy when we went on a weekend evening, but they do delivery through a myriad of channels (and from what I saw, orders were piling up on that end).

Service was great--the servers were rather attentive. I saw one of the waiters having a friendly conversation with another table.
author: Bettina P.

description:
Holy Kitchen has the best Indian food that I've had in the city. I'm never disappointed when I decide to pick up dinner from here (except when it's Monday and I forget that they're closed, but that's on me). The service at Holy Kitchen is great. I can place an order on the phone, leave immediately and have my food be ready when I get to the restaurant in about 10 minutes. The few times I've eaten at the restaurant with friends, the experience was just as good. 

The food itself is outstanding. I love spicy food and Holy Kitchen definitely knows how to make it spicy. I've tried multiple dishes here and they've all be great. Their aloo gobi and butter chicken are personal favorites but the real highlight might be the garlic naan. It's so fluffy and delicious that it makes naan from anywhere else seem not as good.
author: Randal B.

description: Truly one of the best Indian eats in SF. Their food is clean, well prepared and has tons of flavor, without the excess oil and butter that most Indian places have.
author: Sean S.

description:
Omg I love this place. It's a gem not to miss if your taste buds are craving in for some authentic Indian cuisine.
You get that positive vibe the moment you walk in. It is clean & everything seems to be in order. People here are very comforting & attentive, just the way we like it.
We were a group of 4 & we were very hungryyyyy. We ordered Aloo Tikki, Paneer Chili & GOBI MANCHURIAN(don't dare to miss this, its da bomb) for appetizer & then went for Chicken tikka masala, Lamb Curry, Malabar Fish Curry(was a new one to my taste, but glad we ordered it) & Chicken Tandoori for our entree with some Basmati rice & good o'll garlic naans. Everything was tasty & spot on. We ate so much that we couldn't even dare to go for dessert.
So ya, go here, try their amazingly tasty foods, rub your tummy with a smile after u r done eating & thank me later if you felt happy like we did for coming in here. CHEERS.
author: Jeni S.

description:
Hands-down the best Indian food this non-Indian gal has found in SF at a reasonable price point. Most everything tastes amazing, and I list particularly spectacular dishes below. The restaurant is clean, with a light happy atmosphere (think yellow walls and soft Indian music). Some reviews criticize the ambiance because the restaurant is empty, but as far as we can tell the only reason it's occasionally empty are reviews like those! 

The staff are wonderfully accommodating, efficient, and polite. Everyone we take there raves about the food. For us though, the restaurant's kid-friendly nature is the real winner. They love having kids in the restaurant, don't mind when they get the tablecloths dirty, make mild dishes truly mild, have a centrally located and easy to monitor bathroom, offer more than enough highchairs, and don't bat an eyelash when you have to run when the wheels suddenly come off (they grab the check and pack all the leftovers in a snap). Our kids dine here regularly and with no stress. 

As for food, all the chicken dishes we've had were made with large chunks of carefully trimmed breast meat, never gristle. We're particularly fond of the Badami Chicken, a nutty, creamy curry, and the Peas Pilau, a rice dish with nuts and onions. The Chicken Tikka Masala is a bit tomoato-y for my taste, but my daughter and sister-in-law love it. My mom is a huge fan of the Chicken Vindaloo. The Eggplant Bharta is a family favorite. My husband must have the Corn Chat and Chana Masala. We always get the Saag Paneer as well, and have enjoyed the Malabar Fish Curry a few times (it's a creamy coconut sauce similar to the Badami but less nutty). Just writing about it all is making my mouth water. 

Summary: delicious and kid-friendly without losing it's ambiance.
author: Gail C.

description:
Pros: the chicken tikka masala had a lot of sauce and chicken, and both it and the garlic naan had a lot of flavor. The naan was also fluffy and moist.

Mehs: the chicken tikka masala did not come with any rice, but this is mostly my fault as I had assumed it would be included as most other places include rice and because of the cost.

Cons: the chicken was dry and food seemed overpriced.
author: Cody W.

description: Food was OK, not amazing. Best dish was the vegetarian Biryani.
author: Shimrit S.

description:
I've ordered in from here twice and really enjoyed the food. I've had the daal, lamb vindaloo, tandoori chicken and bengan bartha and everything was great. The only disappointment was the second time I ordered naan and it was more like paratha, not like the naan (regular and garlic) we'd had the first time. It was still good, just not what I was expecting. 

One warning: some of these dishes pack some serious heat, so definitely opt down on the heat scale.
author: Casey P.

description: First time order from Holy Kitchen. Each dish had good deep flavors. The amount was generous, and the packaging was good. The dishes arrived still hot and needed no reheating. Very favorably impressed!
author: Robert B.

description: Went here on a Saturday night and there was no wait whatsoever. We got 2 orders of chicken tikka masala + naan and rice palau. The food is very reasonably priced and we still had enough leftovers for about 2 meals! Definitely planning on coming back again in the future.
author: Jordanne G.

description:
Always fresh and hot delivery. 
Everything I've tried has been tasty. Our go to order is Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Korma, Saag Paneer and regular naan. 
One order of rice is enough for two people and then some. 
Holy Kitchen never disappoints.
author: Robyn H.

description:
Get take out.

We arrived on a Sunday night, and the place did have a crowd, but fortunately no wait for a seat. Nor was there a wait for service. But there was a wait for our food.

Even with my vegetarian friend, we decided to go family style and order a bunch of dishes for the table. Granted we mostly ate our own dish, but there was sharing.

After looking over the easy to read but difficult to decide menu, we ordered Lamb Curry, Lamb Tikka, Shrimp Korma and Bengan Bharta, as well as two orders of naan, and white & brown basmati rice, and waited.

And we waited.

And then we realized why: the staff was bringing out huge bags (at least 4 containers) of food for take out. And not just one order this way, at least 4. So this is why I recommend take out.

While we waited, we did get complimentary papadum for the table, which was nice and the sauces were good, and the staff was keeping us updated during the wait - they were incredibly nice.

The food all came out at the same time, and I would say it was solid Indian food. As I haven't had korma in a long time, I was thrilled to see shrimp korma, and the sauce was creamy and flavorful. The two lamb dishes were also great, but were pretty close in flavor. And the eggplant was decent. 

Everyone enjoyed their dishes, but I wouldn't say this is the best Indian I've had in the bay area. But if you were in Noe Valley or Castro Valley and craving Indian, I would recommend this place. Just be aware of wait times before coming - I would first ask how many take out orders have been placed before sitting to get an idea.
author: Michael C.

description:
We ordered food when we were moving to our new place. I was not having great expectations as Indian food home delivered in SF have always let me down. 

But holy kitchen changed my views. The food was amazing. We has palak paneer and chicken. It was great. The biryani was decent too. 

Would love to visit them sometime.
author: Milana R.

description: We love Holy Kitchen. The name is odd but that makes it easy to remember. The Indian food is always fresh and delicious, and the place is run by people who seem genuinely happy to see you walk through the door. There's nothing bad I can think of to say about the restaurant, the food, or the service. It's all excellent!
author: D. W.

description: Just what we needed. We stopped in for a late lunch and were very impressed with the flavors vibe and service. We will be back.
author: Holly R.

description:
Dined in this weekend (I've ordered takeout once before). There was a slow depressing song on loop and we were the only patrons there for at least half an hour, so the ambience was grating and the servers were standing around staring at us. I would have been more relaxed with better music at least. Our male server was borderline snooty and I couldn't understand him, (I asked about spice levels and he laughed at me condescendingly, etc) but the female server was friendly and polite.
The best part of our meal was the garlic naan. Freshly baked fluffy crispy buttery heaven. Dipping it in the Tike Masala was divine! Will probably be back for the naan, but wasn't impressed with the lamb so I'll probably stick with chicken.

Chicken Tike Masala: 4/5
Lamb Vindaloo: 3/5 
Garlic Naan: 5/5
Ambience/Service: 2/5
author: Jordan Q.

description: I love this place. They are friendly, well-priced, great location, and kind. Try the Gobi Manchurian. It is seriously amazing. The butter chicken and the special chicken curry with cashew sauce are stars. Badami, I believe. Chai is great. Their lunch specials are really delicious, huge, and inexpensive.
author: Aaron W.

description:
For some reason, Holy Kitchen always confuses me.

First, I think it's a Middle Eastern place because Holy Kitchen reminds me of Holy Land, and Israeli and Palestinian and even Lebanese places will sometimes make generous references in their names and/or on their menus to the Holy Land.  Not that there aren't other holy lands in the world, but when I think of the Holy Land, I think of historical Jerusalem and present-day Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories.

Second, I think of the place on the south side of Townsend Street between 7th and 8th Streets, before the Caltrain bypass tracks begin.  Isn't that place also called Holy Kitchen?  And doesn't it have a totally different logo from the Noe Valley Holy Kitchen?  Are they related?  Were they related?  How could two Indian places named Holy Kitchen in San Francisco not be related?  I'll have to do some lazy research and report back on this one.

The food is OK.  The delivery can take a while, but I live really far from the Land of the Double-Wide Strollers, so that's not their fault.  Maybe a huge stroller was blocking the street because God knows those things don't fit on the sidewalk, not totally.

Their spiciness meter is busted.  I asked for medium heat on both dishes.  One was relatively hot, which I don't mind, but the other one was like typical-white-guy-from-Omaha-who's-never-had-Indian-food-before mild.  And by that, I mean like ultra super mega mild.

The naan is good.
author: John S.

description:
The best thing about Holy Kitchen is that it's not packed all the time.  The next best thing is the flavor of the food.  Here's what we had on our most recent visit and how we remember it:

Aloo Tikki: super-good!  The deep-fried potato croquettes were just the right size and crispiness, and the tikki sauce it was served with was so flavorful and fragrant in a wonderful way.  It doesn't look like much, but you will want to try this appetizer.

Fish Curry: generous chunks of white fish served in a chunky tomato sauce.  The tomato sauce is not overwhelming, because it's seasoned so nicely that it's actually quite complex.

Saag Paneer: nothing special about this saag, it's pretty standard and by that I mean a decent staple.  There are huge cubes of homemade paneer floating around the curry, which is a good thing.

Lamb Vindaloo:  not the best vindaloo, but very decent, and the medium was spicy enough to make my husband wipe his brow and gulp his water several times.  Even though it was spicy, it was also (purportedly) rich in flavor.

Garlic Naan:  for two people, it was one medium-sized serving that was cut into four little sections.  Not very generous and you'll definitely run out, even if you were metering that naan hardcore.  Also, it's delicious.

Note: Medium spiciness is pretty spicy for most people.  Call ahead and put your name in.

We'd visit again - highly recommend.  Enjoy!
author: Coleen C.

description:
This place is very good, though they still have some bumps to smooth out. I'm giving them a conditional 4 stars here, and will update this review after going again in a week or so. 

We went last night at around 7p, and when we got there, were told to seat ourselves, which was fine - there weren't a lot of people there, so we put ourselves in the little back room. Our waitress was very sweet and friendly, though she did write our order on her hand with a pen, which was a bit odd in my opinion. Anyways, we ordered two beers and an app. 

Our app was the Chili Chicken, and this was the best item of the night. Very, very tasty. I've attached a picture of it (or will attach a picture of it when I can figure out how to). I loooove spicy food (ghost chilis are my fav), so while I thought this was mild, my fiance thought it was more of a medium/hot, and he loved it. I also loved it, though, it was interesting and great!

For meals, I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, extra extra spicy/Indian-style spicy. I promised the waitress upside down and backwards that I would not send it back, and it could not be too spicy. My fiance ordered the Chicken Vindaloo. We also got garlic naan and some basmati rice. 

The chicken tikka masala was tasty, but it was not spicy in the least (this was also confirmed by my fiance). So, that was unfortunate. The waitress never did come by to ask how everything was, so I couldn't say anything. I ended up just eating it. It was good, I don't regret it, I just wish I'd had a chance to say 'hey, can you add a kick to this?'. My fiance doesn't normally like Indian food, but he really enjoyed the Chicken Vindaloo - I actually got an agreement out of him that we can go again! Woohoo!

Oh, I forgot to talk about the naan. Adding this in later, sorry for the edit. I'm not hugely into naan, but my fiance ate all four pieces. He really enjoyed it. I got a bite, and it was fluffy and pretty tasty! The rice was also solid. Just straightforward basmati rice.

At the end, we got our check, and the two beers weren't on it. We pointed that out, and got an updated check with only my beer on it, and the waitress disappeared as soon as she dropped it off again. I gave up at that point and just paid for our meals and one beer, with a little extra on the tip. Just as we were about to leave, the waitress reappeared and told us she had forgotten the second beer, and we needed to pay for it. I ended up just giving her a $10 and leaving (this covered the $4 beer and a remarkable extra tip). I wasn't going to fight over it, but the front of the house is obviously very disorganized. 

As we left, I stopped by the bathrooms - 5 stars there, the bathroom was very clean and nice. Overall, this place is good so far, but I'm holding final judgement until I get a chance to go again. Hopefully they'll have sorted out their service issues the next time I go.

Edited on 5/6/14: Changed this to 5 stars, as after getting takeout three times in the past month or two and having it be wonderfully spicy, I'm completely satisfied and loving this place! I haven't been back for eat-in, so I can't update my review regarding if their service issues were ironed out, but if you ask for "spicy, indian style spicy, seriously please so spicy I am crying" they will do it for takeout! Mmm. Spicy food. Hooray!
author: Erin F.

description: My go-to Indian food spot. It's a bummer that it's closed on Mondays, but a good value and I actually don't get a stomach ache after eating here! I dig the Chicken Tikki Masala (that sauce, when medium, oh yeahhh), and garlic naan.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I was enjoying my shopping experience on 24th street when I realized that it was lunch time.  After contemplating several options, I chose Holy Kitchen.  And, am I glad that I did!
I was greeted warmly and given a table with a view of the street.  The tables were covered in white cloths, and authentic Indian music played in the background.   The server brought some crispy chips made from chickpea flour and two spicy sauces:  a chutney and tamarind.  They had a nice, uncomplicated wine list, and I chose Nobilo Sauvignon Blanc.  I was given a very nice pour of this delicious wine.
I had so many questions about the menu for the server, and she patiently explained everything to me.  I chose the cottage cheese stuffed vegetable balls and ordered the dish extra hot.  I nixed the rice and the naan because I thought that it would have been too much for me.  But now after seeing another patron's naan, I wish that I had ordered it to take back to the hotel.
The dish was delicious!  Vegetable balls had nice chewy texture.  And that sauce!  I could have licked the plate.  It was creamy and pleasantly spicy.  As I always say, it could have been a little hotter, but I was pleased with the flavor.  
The puzzling thing to me is that there were only 3 or 4 patrons in this beautiful restaurant.  Where was everybody?  With this quality of food, service, and atmosphere, I feel sorry for those who got their lunch elsewhere.
author: Robin C.

description: I ordered a chicken tikka masala. The formal definition of this dish is a dish of roasted chunks of chicken tikka in a spicy sauce. The sauce is usually creamy, spiced and orange-coloured. What I received was a few chunks of plain chicken with some soggy onions, no sauce. Keep in mind that the container the food came in was labeled "Tikka Kebab". I then proceeded to talk to their customer service representative for an hour trying to receive a refund. When it looked like i was about to get my order right, the girl tells me that what i ordered was chicken tikka masala and would not get a refund. I know for a fact that bland chicken cubes and wet onions is not CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA.
author: Dana G.

description:
Amazing service!
Amazing tastes!

First time here, will definitely return.  We eat Indian food a couple times a month and this is the best I've had since I moved to the Bay Area in 2010!
author: Aaron P.

description: Healthy and just as spicy as you want. I like that lunch comes with rice, chapatti and bread. Rich and oily bread goes great with spicy curry. Vegan options Available and i really appreciate that.
author: ari s.

description:
Strengths: Tasty, fresh, well-prepared food. It's the best Indian I've had in the city. They ask what heat level you want, and they actually deliver on that. Drinks were always kept full by an attentive and friendly staff.

Weaknesses: The kitchen's timing wasn't great. Breads came out after some of the mains, and the mains themselves were a long time coming.
author: David S.

description:
Went there on a Thursday night. The place has an interesting ambience and friendly staff. Ordered Papdi Chaat, Corn Chaat and Gobi Manchurian to start with. Papdi Chaat was decent, Corn Chaat was pretty bland and the Gobi Manchurian was oh so crispy and delicious. It was a little sweet and might not be to everyone's liking. So make sure to mention you would prefer it to be spicy if that's your thing.

To finish ordered the Vegetable biryani, I asked for medium spicy level and my mouth was on fire 5 minutes in. So choose your spice level carefully. Stuff noticed my obvious discomfort and offered to give me a milder version (which tasted awesome). 

Would definitely visit again
author: Vinay R.

description:
This place is solid--great value, a diverse menu, friendly service, and best of all NO HASSLE! Holy Kitchen a great pick for those Friday or Saturday nights when we wait until the last minute to decide to go out to eat. 

The food is hearty and the portions are pretty substantial. My husband and I usually order naan and two entrees, and each time we've ended up with a doggie bag for leftovers.

I also like how they bring out a complimentary serving of pappadum and chutneys at the beginning of the meal.

One of our favorite things to order is the Lamb Achari (lamb with pickling spices), which was heart and well seasoned. We also enjoyed the Bengan Bharta (roasted eggplant), though it needs to be balanced out with other dishes that have more texture as it itself is pretty mushy.
author: Ali S.

description:
Holy Kitchen has great veggie options and delivers to Bernal Heights!

We are vegetarian and live in Bernal, a bit of a no-persons-land for food delivery. It's so rare to find a place outside of Bernal that delivers, let alone good vegetarian food. Holy Kitchen fit the bill.

My picky eaters devoured the samosas. The naan was yummy. The Daal Tadka was so healthy and had great flavor (got it mild for the kids). My husband loves anything spicy with cauliflower so the Aloo Gobi was perfect for him. I got the Sahi Paneer and it was delish. I ended up feeding a little bowl to my 8 month old (no teeth) and she devoured it. Her first Indian food! I was a little nervous at first. But she slept blissfully the whole night. :)

You must get their mango chutney and raita. I put them on a little of everything we ordered. Not sure if that's traditional or allowed but I loved it. 

I didn't have to cook and this order fed a family of 5 for $55. There were some leftovers for lunch the next day. That's pretty darn awesome.
author: Regina S.

description: Holy Kitchen is absolutely delicious. I've been here twice now for dinner after work and love it. The starter plate that they serve you is absolutely great. When I go there I get the butter chicken, which is full of flavor. I had the mango lassi for the first time recently too and it's so good. I've had a good share of mango lassis and always just assumed they were all the same til this one. The place is great too, they accept credit card and don't have a limit of how many credit cards you can put down at once all together. Service is good too. Probably my new favorite Indian place is the city. I can't wait to order delivery one day. Definitely looking forward to it. Only downside to this place is that they are not open on Mondays.
author: Julie L.

description: Consistently great food at good prices. It's one of our regular dinner spots. I highly recommend the  Papri Chaat. The Butter Chicken is pretty great too. The service is very friendly of you decide to dine in.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Holy kitchen: yuummmmm!!!

This is my favorite Indian food in the city. The naan: amazing, the chicken tikka masala: sublime, saag paneer: perfect, everything else: delicious!

The staff is so friendly and the decor is elegant but understated. HK the perfect meal for any occasion!
author: Tevy D.

description: I've never been to the restaurant but ordered delivery from them many times. It's always piping hot and their flavors are amazing. I particularly like the okra, the bengan bharta, and the paneer makhani. I don't think I've ordered delivery from anywhere else, Indian or otherwise, since I discovered these guys!
author: Simon D.

description:
Disclaimer - I have never eaten in the restaurant, only take out.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about Holy Kitchen.  Always delicious, always spicy, always plenty leftover for a breakfast scramble.  Plus the delivery is super fast!

My husband and I order from Holy Kitchen almost once a week, it's that delicious.  The lamb in the tikka masala is always perfectly cooked and delicious, never gamy or chewy.  The spice levels do not mess around, I like spicy and this place doesn't skimp.  We tried extra spicy once, and cried our eyes out - and we're accustomed to spice.  Order spicy and get some of the delish raita to go with that slow burn.

The garlic naan is wonderful, just the right amount of garlic. Nice and fluffy and thin, perfect for scooping up the yummy bengan bharta.  

Prices are pretty reasonable considering how much food you get, and again delivery is amazingly fast.  One day I'll get off my butt and visit the actual restaurant.
author: Margaret I.

description: Excellent lamb & chicken tikka massala, flavourful and creamy. Also enjoyed their mango lassi. The price is reasonable and both I and my husband loved this place.
author: Marilia S.

description:
I have two conflicting issues: having a toddler and loving Indian food. That means ordering delivery, and good food is hard to find. 

Today I was very pleasantly surprised. Awesome food, my new favorite spot. Food runs on the spicy side of medium, so be careful.
author: Iggy V.

description:
Yay for delivery.

Yay for tasty!

But small chicken pieces with gristle was unexpected at these prices.
author: M K.

description: I'm very upset about my order last night. Uber eats was great, but the food was not. We ordered 2 items we had ordered previously. The Vegetable Korma contained cashews and paneer even though those ingredients are not listed on that dish. With inconsistent ingredients that do not correspond with the described menu items I do not feel comfortable ordering from Holy Kitchen again due to risk of food allergen consumption since the menu description, nor previous experience, can be trusted.
author: Lo B.

description: Good food and great service. Okra vegetable and peas pilau highly recommended. A wonderful neighbourhood restaurant.
author: Amy V.

description:
holy Indian food! the food they served is super flavorful.

this place will definitely be one to  have as bookmark.

the spices are perfect fresh, with so much taste, and that curry salsa it is so good. though, yummy

Chicken Tike Masala delicious with a perfect chilly spice, I love how hot it was 

Chicken Korma right to perfection as I asked for it.. Nothing wrong with the taste I absolutely like that

would love to have more later on. and try more of their menu
author: Ben G.

description: Really tasty dishes and friendly service! A great spot to catch up with a friend and sharing different dishes  will be back
author: Basim F.

description: We really like this restaurant. Great selection of tasty food. Last visit, we had the Gobi Manchurian to start. Then the Badamiu Chicken dish and the vegetarian Saag Paneer. The staff is very pleasant. The owner came and talked with us to see how we liked the meal. We hope it does well although lacking the essential lunch-hour business due to location. Great place for a private meal or to bring out of town guests.
author: Philip G.

description: Did they just get a new chef? We ordered takeout last week, and it was phenomenal. Very flavorful! Favorites were the vegetable korma and the dal.
author: Leigh A.

description:
Ordered delivery from this place through eat24. It was an excruciating two and a half hour wait after which I just had to cancel my order. 

Wish I knew how the food actually tasted, but I'm probably not going to bother coming here with this kind of service.
author: Vin A.

description: We ordered delivery and were surprised and delighted.  Chicken tikka masala, lamb rojan curry, lamb archeta.  All excellent and spiced just right- we ordered "spicy" and it was.  Glad we didn't order very spicy which I almost did since most places don't spice enough for us.
author: Caryn S.

description:
If you love Indian food, you have to Holy Kitchen it! After unsuccessfully looking a nice Indian restaurant that delivers in Bernal Heights, we discovered Holy Kitchen.  And are we happy we did! 

Food here is amazing - fresh, flavorful and overall delicious.  I have dined in and ordered in multiple times from here and have never been disappointed.  The food tastes very authentic and more than anything else, it is flavorful.  With each scoop of Lamb Masala, you appreciate the effort taken to make the complex flavors in the dish.  

On the appetizer side I love their chats (both papdi and aloo) and Tangdi Kabab.  The chats are an explosion of flavors while the Kabab is very tender.  On the curries side, I love the Lamb Tikka Masala, Fish Curry (one of my all time favs) and Bengan Bharta.

The servings here are very generous, the staff is friendly and ambiance is laid-back.  A perfect place to eat some tasty morsels and drink some chai as you chat with friends and family!
author: Jyotshna K.

description: We stopped into Holy Kitchen a week or so ago just looking for something different for dinner.  We were totally surprised how good the food was. The Gobi Manchurian (batter dipped cauliflower with a sweet/spicy sauce) appetizer was amazing & Onion Kulcha was fresh with tons of onions. The good/bad news is that they also deliver. Dangerous, but good.
author: Bobbi L.

description: the veggie korma and the cashew chicken are great! samosas are also excellent.
author: Button L.

description:
Yet another "just OK" Indian restaurant in San Francisco. We had lunch at Holy Kitchen. One of us ordered the tandoori chicken lunch plate, the other the chilli paneer appetizer with a side of garlic naan.

The good: portion sizes were large. The mixed vegetables that came with the chicken were pretty good. Both the garlic naan and the plain naan (a side on the lunch special) were excellent - fresh and crispy.

The not-as-good: the tandoori chicken was just OK. The chilli paneer was not awful but not very good either. The pappadums that came in advance of the rest of the food were stale. 

$25 for lunch (not including tip) is not awful but maybe a couple bucks on the high side.

Very clean, pleasant atmosphere, good service. We'll probably give it another try to see if we just ordered the wrong dishes.
author: David G.

description: Best Indian food in SF in terms of flavor! Truly! Amazing chicken tikka, great lunch specials.  Unfortunately, the last 2 times I ordered chicken tikka masala to go/delivery I got a bowl of sauce with a few pieces of chicken in it.  It was like I had ordered a masala sauce "soup" that just happened to have a few small pieces of chicken in it.  Just disappointing, especially for the price.  The sauce is great, but I expected a chicken dish, not just a bowl of sauce.
author: R X.

description:
Extremely attentive staff. Excellent quality food. And yes, you pay Noe Valley price but it's totally worth it because you're supporting a local family business. Their other joint is Little Delhi on Mason, my other fav Indian in the city. The place is very homey.  There's a separate area at back where I can see a birthday dinner or something for large group.  

Back to food.  They serve you complimentary papadum and those warm sugar ball for desert.  I loved my Saag Panner (always a good test base), with chunky spinach and delicate cheese cubes. My partner loved his Lamb Tikki Masala, he says they are tender and the creamy tomato sauce is not sour.  We ordered mild and they did come out mild!

This place is only 3 months old and I think they're on the right track.  I will definitely come back to support our new neighbor.
author: D M.

description:
What a terrific way to make a miserable day better.

Me and my wife had been moving all day. We gave our notice over a month ago at our old apartment, and have been searching for the right place. Long story short, we didn't find a place that suits our needs, so we ended up moving all our stuff to storage and staying at our friends' apartment in Noe Valley while we keep searching.

The move out day was a pain in the ass. We have a 10 month old daughter and trying to do all this stuff, manage the movers etc, signing up for the storage and fitting everything in, moving the rest of our stuff etc to our temp place, all the while taking care of a 10 month old, is difficult to say the least.

The last hours I found the hardest. The move out really got to me at a level I didn't know existed. We got through it though, but I felt sad and incomplete.

As it approached dinner time, I realized that it was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty. as Jonathan Safran Foer once put it.

Anyways, we decided to find a place close by and randomly ended up in Holy Kitchen. Me and my wife really like Indian food so we were excited to try a new place.

And BOOM. Boy did we have Indian food. The food was so good, the nan was probably the best nan I've had in the city. The place is small and nice and all the staff were really nice.

I had the chicken vindaloo, and it was probably one of the best chicken vidnaloos I've had. Darbar in palo alto also has pretty decent chicken vindaloo, and theirs is probably a bit hotter, but this felt like the perfect match of hotness, taste and freshness.

They didn't have mango juice, only mango lassis but that will not detract from the 5 star rating.

My wife had the butter chicken and really liked it as well - I didn't try it but it looked delicious.

Long story short, the emptiness, the hole inside of myself was filled. Filled with delicious vindaloo chicken and the nicest nan i've had. Holy Kitchen filled my empty heart. Or at least my stomach.
author: Arnor S.

description:
Best Indian Curry in San Francisco by a very very long way.
For English Curry eaters San Francisco is typically a bit of a let down in the curry department, where normal fare is plain cold blob of rice with chicken cubes served in a tomato soup with curry power in it (if you're lucky).
At the Holy kitchen they know how to embellish the curry and so expect peas, nuts and seeds and other things - which is fantastic. Tikka Masala is great and so are the naans.
author: Robin S.

description:
Ordered this for delivery. 
 
Delivery time was longer than normal (more than 1 hour), which was really disappointing. 

The garlic nan was burnt on the bottom and the taste of the nan in general was a bit disappointing. 

Tikka Masala was good, but not having good nan really kind of just make it ok.
author: Suzie B.

description:
Holy Kitchen delivers. But through a service, that takes FOREVER. So order an hour before you're hungry.

The food was good, but it took a really long time. We've been searching for a new Indian delivery place since Spicy Bite just won't cut it any longer.

Holy Kitchen's food was very good, but it took over an hour and twenty minutes to get to our place. I'm sure we'll give it a try again, and that they're working out the kinks...
author: Lani N.

description:
When I heard that the folks from my favorite delivery Indian in the city, Little Delhi were opening this place I was thrilled. Now I can get all my favorite Indian food hot and close by since its in the neighborhood. I had all my usual favorites and everything was great.

Chicken Korma
Samosa
Tikka Massala

All excellent. Service for pickup was friendly and ready when I got there.

So nice to have Indian food in the neighborhood.
author: Michael M.

description: Great food and good ambiance, super quite. Went with 2 picky Indian food lovers. Food is not oily like in most places and you will get the flavor.
author: mustapha m.

description: Wonderful hidden gem - was rushing for an appointment nearby and they cooked quickly and the food was tasty and fresh and the service friendly and the place was cozy clean and sunny. They accommodated my paleo tendencies generously. Recommended for a casual nice experience!
author: Andrew K.

description:
This little gem is not that noticeable from the street and you might walk by it with out really noticing it. Have been here a few times mostly for take out. They are constantly helpful and extremely nice. 

The daal was delicious and every one in my family devoured it. The chicken curry dish we had was well balanced and full flavor. We will be making this a neighborhood fav for sure.  

Tonight while I was waiting for my take out they served me the most delicious cup of complementary tea!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Was looking forward to trying a new Indian restaurant close to home. Having been unable thus far to find a go to Indian place in the city I had hoped this one would beat the trend.  It didn't - and I came away with another disappointment.

Tried their #2 lunch special consisting of a nondescript and rather bland chicken dish and a somewhat over salted paneer sag, huge pile of rice, a salad and the only good point of the meal - the naan. Unsure of any new restaurant I asked for medium spicy. The food was really bland and nothing except the salt in the spice department stood out. The staff were nice and the interior was fine, but that should be the norm.

I will not be returning and the search continues.
author: Easwud C.

description: Have ordered to-go and takeout a bunch of times from Holy Kitchen and their food never disappoints. The butter chicken is absolutely delicious. Would definitely recommend it.
author: Ankit S.

description:
Wish I could rate this higher, but honestly, we just weren't wowed. I want to support local businesses, but I think this one could do better -- much better. 

1. Our main issue was how BLAND everything was. We got six different dishes, and all were lacking in flavor.
2. The main ingredient in each dish -- e.g., shrimp, chicken, veggies, whatever -- was very sparse. The portions overall were good, but you had to really hunt and peck for the good stuff.
3. The raita had about a half inch of thin watery stuff that had risen to the top because they had not strained the yogurt, or if they did, they didn't strain it long enough. When I spooned it on the entrees, it was like spooning white water.

We'll give it another try, but so far, not impressed.
author: E. G.

description: Surprisingly good! Authentic tasting and some complex flavors.  Recommend the Lamb Achari and the chicken tikka.  Only thing that let it down was the Tandoori Roti.
author: Rajash S.

description: Food ok, but like the veggie options. Service adequate. Ambiance is uninspired. Found prices of dishes to be too high.
author: Bruce K.

description: Ordered delivery and had a great experience. I've been looking for a good Indian restaurant to get delivery from for the past few months and Holy Kitchen has been the best so far. I got the chicken tikka masala, lamb achari, samosas, and mango lassi. Everything was good but the lamb was my favorite. Delivery came earlier than the estimated time.
author: Maya E.

description: Service and atmosphere was great. It was veey cozy and quiet. Unfortunately, the food was bland. I had to sprinkle salt on in to get any flavor.
author: Sean B.

description: I have tried many Indian places in the city and this is definitely my favorite. The CTM is one of the best I've had. The chicken itself has a great tandoori flavor; often times it is bland and all you can taste is the sauce. Their naan and paratha always has the perfect texture and flavor. I also get take-out from here often, and it always comes quickly and is hot and fresh on arrival. I have nothing bad to say!
author: Kurt K.

description: This restaurant has amazing Indian food. The dahl is delicious and the naan tastes like it's fresh-baked. Not only is the food wonderful, but the servers are very helpful and have a great sense of humor. Since my daughter and I are vegetarian, it's usually hard for us to find a goof food option. But Holy Kitchen had enough vegetarian selection, we had a lot to choose from. I'd definitely recommend it!
author: Leslie C.

description: Very good food! Savory and delicious. I'm especially enjoying the tender, perfect garlic chunks in the daal. The naan is fluffy & buttery!
author: Liz H.

description:
Great food and great service. Buttered chicken and lamb tikka masala were fantastic! Great for dipping naan! 

We was walking by and decided to stop in... and I'm glad we did. Completely worth it. And I'm happy they have a take out service, which I will definitely be taking advantage of.
author: Andrew P.

description: We've ordered delivery a number of times via postmates or order ahead. Each time the food has been quite good, however recently the quality has gone down hill. Our chicken dish was full of gristle and bones, the naan was hard and stale. Don't think we will be ordering Holy Kitchen again.
author: Lyz S.

description:
We had a nice dinner of Gobi Manchurian, Corn Chaat, Lamb Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer and a mango lassi. The lassi was one of the best that I ever had. The "mild" versions of the food were ho-hum. I will try again, but at a spicier level. Hopefully that will make me love them as other reviews do. 

We got in at 6:30 on a Thursday and were easily seated. The staff took extra care with our daughter who was surprisingly timid with them. So if you have kids, this is a good place to go.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
Our regular Indian restaurant. We went when it first opened and dined in. The owner was very nice and spent time talking to us before our meal came. The food is always good. 

We get takeout or delivery from them weekly but also take family to dine in when they are in town. Not sure why it's not always busy but it means we get very quick service. 

I've been to India and can say that this is quality Indian food.
author: Robin H.

description:
Fantastic! I'm here on their second night being open, and wow this place is great! Chana Masala and Chicken Tikka Masala were perfect. Add Great ambiance and giant glasses if wine made the whole experience worth writing about.
I'll be a regular here for sure!
author: Kris H.

description: this place is one of the best cheap eats in SF; they serve the best peas pillau I have ever had and their onion kulcha is excellent! fine in or take out, holy kitchen is the best bang for your buck: the food, the service and the casual ambiance make this the best dinner spot on 24th street. highly recommend!!
author: Tyler W.

description: Ordered delivery via Eat24, it took 2 hours, and an extra hour after the expected delivery time they gave us. We asked for no cilantro on each individual item, everything came covered in it. A crappy first experience.
author: Kate H.

description:
Decent food, the spicy isn't immediately spicy but will start causing you to water up after a bit. The prices are a bit high but it's a good indian place, they gave out free papard with our meal which was pretty nice.

I approve of their Mango Lassi, so it's a good place to go back.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Great food, good service, and decent prices.

Really enjoyed our dinner here and the wait staff was very attentive.

Medium spicy was a great level of spice and the naan was really delicious.
author: mike m.

description: Not the best experience. Both vegetable and chicken biriyani was dry and overly spicy when we requested mild. The garlic Naan was ok. Clay Oven was a way much better.
author: Gordon C.

description: Don't bother.  Was hoping to find a good local Indian place - instead we were served chicken tika that tasted like the bird had just been defrosted and naan was dry and tasteless.
author: flubadub A.

description: This is my favorite spot for Indian food in san Fran. I try and go every time I'm in town.
