Recently  my family ordered the chana masala, chicken vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and the saag paneer, among other dishes. Everything came out hot and delicious, and the service is always prompt and the staff are attentive and polite. The ambiance of the restaurant is calm with natural light streaming in from the front windows. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for authentic delicious Indian food!
author: Allison L.

description:
It's hard to find good Indian food in the area and this place is definitely good. The spices taste great and the servings are generous, and they give you the option of choosing spice level. The lunch special is awesome but it's definitely worth exploring the rest of the menu. This place has everything a vegetarian lover of North Indian fare could ask for.
     If I could critique anything it would be that the sound could use some help with music or something a little louder.
author: Saul C.

description: Giving 5 stars for the excellent and delicious food, and for the friendly staff. I give 4 stars for ambiance. I wish the lights were a touch dimmer, but who really cares about that when the food is so good??? Eat there. You will not be disappointed.
author: jennifer m.

description:
Another good Indian restaurant in San Francisco. We had lunch at Holy Kitchen. One of us ordered the tandoori chicken lunch plate, the other the chilli paneer appetizer with bean sprouts.

The portion sizes were very large. The mixed vegetables that came with the chicken were pretty good. Both the garlic naan and the plain naan (a side on the lunch special) were very good.


The lunch special prices for lunch of about $25.00 was a good value.

Good service, clean, nice atmosphere
author: Leonard H.

description: Omg best Indian food I've had in sooo long. Even the crispy bread stuff in the beginning (which I usually hate) is awesome. Butter chicken is delicious, chai is REAL CHAI, and the rice with peas and fried onion is fantastic. I liked the cumin lemonade but my fiancé did not.
author: Samantha H.

description: Slightly on the expensive side for Desi food but this place is the only restaurant in town that may beat my homemade dal for deliciousness. The butter chicken is super tasty and rich with much higher quality meat than you will find at Pakwan or Naan n Curry type joints. I usually get takeout or delivery but the atmosphere is pleasant and they have a decent wine selection as well.  A staple in my regular rotation. Love this place!
author: P P.

description: Every dish I ordered tasted like it had a cup of salt poured into it. Not very good at all, but given the location and the clientele of the area, it makes sense.
author: A W.

description:
New place in Noe Valley for Indian, easy review:

Positives: Tasty food, good service, very friendly place.

Negatives: I saw people waiting for their takeout for at least 20 minutes. Also they were slightly under-staffed on a Friday night. They could do with some more ambiance - maybe more things on the wall to soak up some conversation noise or more music. 

I hope they stick around!
author: Brooke N.

description: I am saved!  I have tried every delivery Indian food restaurant that will come to my house since I moved to this neighborhood 3 years ago & THIS IS THE ONE.  The food is spooky identical to my old favorite (ie. 'creamy' means creamy - not greasy / clumpy.  The chicken is succulent / not cartilagey & the chunks are nice & large in their korma.)  The quality of everything I ordered was phenomenal.  After reading all these yelp comments - I fully expected to wait 2 hours to find out if they were good - but they were here before the 60 minute delivery clock ticked down.  I wish I had more thumbs up to give them.
author: Kali C.

description: Currently waiting for the check. Party of 5 came in at 7. Couldn't get out by 830. Horrible service. My friend found a hair in his food. When the bill came, he was charged for his meal that had a hair in it. Totally absurd. There was a HAIR in it. Then the staff complained about a bad tip at the end. STAY AWAY!!
author: Elliott F.

description: This is my go to place for take out Indian in Noe Valley. The combination of the savory Butter Chicken and the Peas Pilau is my personal favorite, but you generally can't go wrong. Food is hot and consistently ready within 15 minutes.
author: William W.

description: After 10 years in London and some amazing Indian food I have been concerned where to find good Indian food in SF. Well I think I've found it! First time order last night (lamb rogan josh with peas pilau and garlic naan), prompt delivery by Postmates. Nice hot comfort food. I can only guess it will be even better in the restaurant.
author: George L.

description: Fantastic Indian food at an affordable price. Nice people working there too going out of their way to create a nice service experience. Not too crowded and have often been able to get a seat for 2 or 3 people just by walking in without a reservation. They were kind to me and my child even when she was acting up and spilling her water all over the floor. The waitress who works there just happens to be gorgeous. Both in-restaurant dining and take-away service are both fast and organized. Lots of vegetarian options. I'm a fan.
author: Paul S.

description: Four stars for Holy Kitchen.  One star for me - for not going sooner.  I'll confess: The reason I didn't go sooner is because it always looked empty when I walked by.  I don't know why it's not more popular.  It's a nice space with really good food.  Learn from my foolish mistake.  Ignore the half-empty dining room that you see from the sidewalk.  Go.  I went for lunch today.  $10.  And it's not just a really good deal.  It's really good.
author: Steve C.

description: Ordered for pickup and was surprised at the speed it was prepared (20 minutes) and how nice the environment was when I arrived for pickup. We got the Butter Chicken & the Sag Paneer and one portion of rice and everything tasted flavorful & good. I asked them to make them mild, and they truly did - there was no spice at all, so bear that in mind when asking for mild. Maybe next time I'll ask for something between mild & medium. :)
author: Sonya Z.

description:
This is hands down the best Indian food we've gotten for delivery. I definitely recommend Aloo Tikki, Peas Pilau, and Lamb Bhuna. The Chicken Tikka Masala is great, it's not too sweet, and the chicken is nice and moist.

I didn't want to give them 5 stars because I find the naan to be too salty, but other than that the naan is very good. Didn't seem like a good enough reason to hold that back.
author: B F.

description: Once you eat here you will return again and again...Promise...Food may be ordered mild or spicy or in between...Butter chicken, onion kulcha, naan, saag paneer and biriyanis are all stellar palate pleasers and the samosas and chai are nicely balanced...I am going to try other things but since I am in love with the butter chicken it is hard not to re-order over and over. Go now as your stomach and spirit will thank you! The owners and servers serve graciously from their hearts.
author: Alanna Z.

description:
Holy crap, that delivery man is rude. I got a call from the restaurant saying that the delivery guy couldn't find our apartment, so I went outside to try to flag him down. When I got outside, the delivery guy screamed at me, saying that it was my fault he couldn't figure out how to use the intercom? All you have to do is dial # and the apartment number.. I even wrote it in the instructions for him. Besides, couldn't he have just called my cell phone? 

The food's okay but sorry -- not worth having this delivery guy come scream at me for no reason. I'd forgive if it were the first time but this delivery guy has always been awful. No more.
author: Miles O.

description: The low rating is mainly due to delivery issues. We were quoted a time, called 30 minutes after the supposed delivery time and were just given excuses. The driver showed up then another 10 minutes later and basically told us that he was leaving the restaurant when we called. The food was luke warm too. And the samosas were meh but that could be because they were sitting in the kitchen. The chicken tikka and vindaloo were good, though. The naan just tasted like any other bread.
author: Callie B.

description: I really enjoyed the food here. It's a bit more modern than most Indian places in the bay but the food was really tasty, nicely priced and the service was great. I would definitely return for good indian food.
author: Patience H.

description: The more I come here, the more I love it. The best Indian food in the City, no doubt. Be sure to try the dishes you won't get elsewhere, like the lamb Achari, lamb Rezala, Badami chicken, and the two fish curries. The standards like the okra, eggplant, butter chicken, and lamb rogan josh are also excellent. The vindaloo also has a distinctive taste that I much prefer over the version common elsewhere.
author: Galen G.

description: Quick delivery; but very average food. Lots of better restaurants in the area and certainly better Indian restaurants in the city.
author: Ankur V.

description:
Great Indian/Nepalese cuisine, really nice ambiance, attentive service, excellent value.  After my first recent visit, I have already been back twice.  Yummy!!!

Easy neighborhood parking.  Highly recommended.
author: Gary R.

description: Ordered food here tonight. It was 30 minutes late and the delivery bag reeked of cigarettes.
author: Katie L.

description: Very mediocre Indian food. Lamb biryani was a rip off... I have had much better Indian food before.
author: Sonja S.

description: Awesome food! We got medium spicy for ours and it was perfectly seasoned. Simmosas were killer!  The Tikka Chicken Masala was great. They have very good garlic naan and roti that made a great pair with the delicious brown and white jasmine rices drowning in the overflow of sauces. Yummy! Their wine selection was minimal, but at least they had that. We enjoyed the house Chardonnay that was very light bodied; a fuller body would be a better suggestion to accommodate the spices in the food served here.
author: Melissa M.

description: Was in the area for work and decided to come here for lunch. What a great decision. Ordered Sahi Paneer and Garlic Naan. Absolutely delicious... Being an Indian i was surprised by the flavors it had. I've been to a lot of Indian restaurants in Bay Area, this one comes in the top 5 I've tried. A must try in this neighborhood.
author: Kristal T.

description: I'm happy to give 5 stars! Not only did we have fanastic Indian food speedily delivered to our door (less than 20 mins) but we had access to an efficient support system to help fix a mistake we made in our order. Badami chicken - beautifully creamy, nutty and mild; lamb vindaloo - tender and plenty spicy, just as it should be; peas pillau - just awesome; masala papad - crispy papad with a great salsa-like topping/dip; and the Naan (we got plain) was perfect and plentiful. I look forward to trying everything else on the menu.
author: Susan A.

description: For once, non-salty Indian food! Not as spicy or tasty as the greasier and saltier spoons, but really quite good.
author: A B.

description:
Ordered food online, and it arrived before the scheduled delivery time. However, upon arrival, the delivery man yelled at me, telling me I lived way too far away, and I should never order again. I live fairly centrally in SF, and the restaurant offered delivery to my area, so I didn't think anything of ordering from a restaurant slightly outside my immediate neighborhood. 

Well, wish granted. Never ordering again. Not worth being yelled at for mediocre food.
author: Becca W.

description: So glad there's a good Indian place in the neighborhood. This Friday night the place was packed yet the service was excellent. Many tasty veggie options, good for my wife and I as we don't eat meat.
author: Michael F.

description: So great to have good Indian food close by!  I enjoyed my saag paneer and peas pullao.  Hasi, the owner, also runs Little Delhi near Union Square.  I'm guessing that Holy Kitchen is his kinder, gentler take on Hell's Kitchen!  Take that Gordon Ramsay!
author: Ravi C.

description:
Been back a few times and have the following updates:
- spice level seems to vary a lot but I'm not a fan of the mild version of most things
- garlic naan is insane, don't unless you are hunting vampires later that night
- service was pretty bad the one weekday night we went, definitely not the "A" team

Still good but I'd take it down to perhaps 3.5 stars (argh, rounding!)
author: Trishan A.

description: A new favorite spot in Noe Valley. Great menu options and we've had really nice service every time. Sometimes the wait for your dish to come out can seem long, but it tastes as if the dish was made fresh just for you. The atmosphere of the restaurant is a bit bare and could use some warmth, but definitely not a reason to not try this place out.
author: Barbie L.

description: Not only does Holy Kitchen have delicious food, but they offer some of the best service I've ever experienced in a modestly priced restaurant. You get a lot for your money as well! We always take home leftovers.
author: Naomi W.

description: Came in one afternoon for a late lunch. Received good service, the food was excellent and large portions. It's the only Indian restaurant near me, fortunately it's quite good.
author: Will D.

description: Great restaurant. Dined here twice now and thoroughly enjoyed every dish. Service very attentive and personal. Hard to pinpoint a favorite dish. Loved the Aloo Tikki and Tandoori chicken. My husband has tried both the chicken biryiani and the chicken vindaloo and loved them both. He asked for them 'hot' and they didn't disappoint. We are british and like a spicy, good curry. Holy kitchen is very authentic and ticks all the boxes. Best curry we've had in the 4 years since we moved here. Looking forward to going back. Oh, and the naan bread is outstanding...
author: Jenny G.

description: Best Indian in the city. They make it nice and spicy and we haven't had a bad dish yet.
author: dan b.

description: This place is great! I come here regularly (or order take-out) and it's always delicious and the service is always super friendly. I would definitely recommend Holy Kitchen to anyone.
author: Emily W.

description: Best Indian food I have had in SF. Can't get enough of the chicken Tikka Masala or Saag Paneer. Friendly staff and fine atmosphere. Only gripe: way too much packaging for take out orders - wish they would ditch the plastic bags.
author: Brad K.

description: Amazing experience!  I asked for a vegetable vindaloo special made, and they made it with no questions asked.  The staff was friendly and quick to serve.  The chef even came out and asked how our meal was, offering us free rice pudding!   I am definitely coming back.
author: Jak G.

description: Was searching for some good Gobi Manchurian tonight and landed at this gem. Very clean and inviting ambiance, good food and friendly service. They kept my 1 1/2 year old entertained is what compels me to give them a 5 star review (We usually do to-go's as it is tough to get our kiddo to cooperate with eating in). All the servers engaged warmly with my daughter. We ordered Paneer Shaslik (mild spicy), Gobi Manchurian and some kulchas..It was correctly spiced, and was not reeking with oil (as is the case with many Indian restaurants we've eaten at). Also its one of the low priced restaurants for the area. Would love to come back again. Thanks for a great dinner!
author: Sreejitha V.

description: We were thrilled when we saw that an Indian restaurant had finally opened on 24th St in Noe Valley. We have only tried takeout once but are delighted with the food so far. We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Aloo Gobi and both were excellent. The Tikka Masala tasted perhaps a little too tomatoey to begin with but after it had sat for a couple of days and reheated, the flavors blended wonderfully together and my wife, who was born in India, declared it the best Tikka Masala she had ever eaten! The dishes a little pricey for a neighborhood Indian restaurant but given the quality are worth it. We will update this review as we try more dishes.
author: Geoff L.

description: Food good. Delivery bad. I had to go downstairs and wait at the curb for the delivery guy to swing by. Then the driver was very demanding about the tip. Save yourself the hassle and just go pick up their food, which is actually quite tasty.
author: Alisha M.

description: Consistently amazing! Every dish is top notch! The baingan bharta is truly amazing - get it spicy - and the korma is de...lightful!
author: Brent W.

description: I will need to eat-in to truly give a fair review so please take this review as my experience with take-out and delivery.  We live in the nearby 'hood called Glen Park, so this is a great to order delivery from when we don't feel like cooking.  As I've mentioned in other review of Indian dining establishments, it doesn't compare to Spicy Bite.  I'm a fan but it isn't my go-to.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Genuine and very good Indian food.

Tried the Samosa, Chicken Korma, and Chicken Tikka Masala. All of them very good. Will definitely come back.
author: X O.

description: I have eaten Indian food all my life and I seriously think Holy Kitchen makes some of the best. . . and I had my order delivered!  Vegetable byriani, aloo gobi, daal, saag paneer - simple and delicious.  I can't wait to try the restaurant in person.
author: Ms. C.

description: Great new quiet restaurant with simple ingredients, simple decor, attentive service and tasty food! We had the tandoori chicken,  saag paneer,  naan, and chai... all for under $30. Great value for money.  I'll be back!
author: Eric W.

description: Delicious food, very fast delivery.  Portions were a little light.

Visiting from Kansas, our son took us to this wonderful place. Full of sunshine, and sparkling clean, the food was delicious and the service impeccable. I loved the curries and the mango lassi. How I wish I lived in Noe Valley to be able to eat there all the time. Another wonderful surprise: it was quiet, and most reasonably priced.
author: Jean G.

description: Writing this as I sit here eating my leftovers from our second visit to Holy Kitchen the other day. Food is delicious! So nice to have a great Indian restaurant nearby in the heart of Noe Valley (less than a block up the hill from 24th and Castro, still very central) for dining in or take-out/delivery. Portions are generous (still have MORE leftovers leftover) and the flavors are wonderful. Try the Papdi Chat to start. It's like an indian version of nachos (but much better and better for you) with crunchy chips, garbanzo beans, potatoes, yogurt, & chutney. The Chicken Tikka is excellent, the vegetarian dishes are fresh and flavorful and the Biryanis are more than a meal in themselves. Overall the food is not too heavy, like it can be at some Indian places and the staff is very friendly. Looking forward to a long and tasty relationship.
author: Josh D.

description: Consistently good. This little gem located in Noe Valley is such a great fit! I recommend the Chicken Tandoori served hot on a skittle and the Lamp Chops are TDF. ( To Die For) Take out and open for lunch a plus.
author: Dani S.

description: Yum! Delicious food you can taste the freshness. Not your typical Indian, the cuisine is somewhat eclectic and very tasty. Superb service. I want to keep coming back to try all the dishes. Their prices are fair = great value. And when the owner is there making sure you're satisfied, that ranks high in my book!
author: Dhar J.

description: Great Lunch Specials and also a nice menu selection.  Thankful to have this in Noe Valley!
author: Robbie M.

description: What a nice surprise!  Holy Kitchen is a terrific neighborhood spot for Indian food.  Everything was super tasty, reasonably priced and the service was very nice.  We particularly liked the shrimp curry and the lamb saag.
author: laurel t.

description: Have been walking by this place on 24th for months since it opened. It is probably an authentic dining room, but too sterile and brightly lit. Great for dental work, but not very fun or romantic. But finally we thought we'd try it so we ordered take out. Problem solved. Spectacular curries each offered in three grades of spiciness. The fish dish was the best Indian I've ever had. The nan was hot and melt in your mouth good. This place is now a once a week spot for us. Try it.
author: k m.

description: The food is fine, but if you order takeout, be prepared to wait 30+ mins after the time they tell you.  It's not worth the wait.
author: Ryan H.

description: This place was wonderful! Went there for lunch on a Tuesday, so naturally it was pretty  empty. My friend and I both ordered the lunch specials, which were quite big. I got the chicken tikka masala which was served with rice, curried vegetables, a salad and naan. Everything was excellent. Sometimes Indian can be somewhat oily but this was fresh and felt light. I will definitely be back and likely get takeout. An added bonus is that if you bring kids on Tuesday for lunch you get 15% off. They might want to rethink that after the noise my toddler companion made, but it made us feel welcome!
author: christine c.

description:
3.5
I live in Noe Valley so I had to try Holy Kitchen.
Bad: Acoustics. Could hear everything the other 3 tables were talking about - so no smack talk could be had at our table.   : ) 
Good: Service. Way friendly staff. Polite and pleasant. 
Aiiight: Food.  Okra - overcooked. Dal- the star. Sag Paneer - Ok.  Nan and Kulcha- pretty good. Paratha - dry. Papadam w/ pico de gallo - light, fresh, tasty. Samosa- mmm - aiiight. Batter-fried paneer w/ chili -- a little chewy -- tasted "fake" - I'd suggest no batter on the fry - just str8-up paneer. 
Verdict: I'll be back just cuz I live in Noe Valley and don't really care for many of the local eatings spots. I'll try a few more dishes and be perfectly happy w/  the terrific service, dal and papadam thing. Oh, and a decent Riesling. Prob ask to sit in the back next time so we can smack talk.
author: Carson R.

description: Best Indian restaurant we've been to in San Francisco.  Owner is super nice and will take care of you.
author: Taylor S.

description: Great staff!  Very attentive and excellent service for a Saturday night.  And such delicious food! We had the Gobi Manchurian as an appetizer to start, and it was fantastic!  The Lamb Saag and Chicken Tandoori were also excellent.  A wonderful, relaxing way to enjoy a meal on a Saturday evening.  Give them a try! :)
author: Terri L.

description: I love their first location in Downtown ( little Delhi ) so I decided to visit this one for the first time. We were the first customers for their dinner. We were greeted promptly and the place looked clean but my plates were dusty and I just took another one from another table.. The music in the background was sad maybe that's the reason why the employees were not smiling. We got our food pretty quick it was a bit bland and it only lasted warm for couple of seconds. My husband I were expecting more flavor since the prices are a little higher than their restaurant downtown. My husband and I asked to talk to the owner because we had met him downtown several times, and we wanted to give him some feedback. she didn't say no and it seemed she understood what we're asking but she just stood there, staring at us and never got the owner for Us. We will come back again to give them another chance if not we will stick to their other location.
author: Darling L.

description: Awesome food, great price, friendly staff.  Cannot ask for more. The best curry I've had in SF by a mile.
author: Shaun G.

description: Food was average, delivery was horrible. It took 2 hours and 15 minutes for delivery. Won't be ordering from them again.
author: Michael L.

description: Love their Butter Chicken and Malabar Fish Curry.  Easily one of our neighborhood favorites now, along with Saru Sushi and Contigo.  Noe's slowly shaking off its rep for rubbish food.
author: Suji O.

description: Really delicious Indian food, very fresh and flavorful. Portions were generous and service attentive. I will be going back here in the future.
author: Amy S.

description: Food was just ok. Chana masala was bland and not spicy. The chai was decent. They messed up my roti order and it took them forever to bring the original order and the replacement order. I asked them half portion for the replacement and they thought I cancelled the replacement and finally brought me the full portion of the replacement order. They were sufficiently apologetic about the mess up, but not apologetic on bringing full portion for replacement. I was trying to avoid wastage and left with a sour taste in my mouth.
author: Vinod K.

description:
I live a 1/2 a bloc away from Holy Kitchen and love Indian food so I was very happy they opened. The first time we went was late on Mothers Day. There were only a few people in the restaurant but it took a very long time to be served. I had chicken curry, meat and gravy only, which was far to spicy for me, I had asked for medium and was told that it would be mild.
My second visit at eight on a recent Friday, again just a handful of people eating but a fair amount of takeouts. We were seated and after 15 minutes I had to ask for menu's. The phone kept on ringing with no one answering it,there was  a small line of people waiting to be seated or for take out. The scene was very surreal, the one owner and the waitress were both very stressed. We decided to do a take out instead of staying as we had a toddler with us who became fussy. Our food to go took quite a long time to get. They had packed one dish we did not order and when we got home they did not give us the two rice orders we had asked for. This place desperately needs help and maybe hire more people. I have never had such a strange restaurant experience. I thought the food was just OK but disappointing. I will never try them again.
I do hope they get it together the owners seem very nice.
author: Cary F.

description: Made online order, went to pick up and had to wait over an hour with lots of other people in same situation. No apology or offer of discount. Terrible customer service.
author: steve g.

description: Wow. I've given this place so many chances, but the delivery man ruins it for me every time. At some point, I should just realize that it's just not worth the pain that I put myself through. So many better Indian places in the area.
author: Chris P.

description: The take-out chicken vindaloo had 5-6 pieces of very rubbery chicken in a bowl full of overly spicy sauce. I'm not docking stars for the spiciness as that's very much a personal opinion but the quality and quantity of the chicken felt like cafeteria food.
author: O W.

description: Delicious, fresh tasting and great service.  Definitely stop in!  Sitting by the window while enjoying my lunch, I've seen a number of people peer in and move on. They are missing out!
author: vanessa e.

description: Great food, the service is always good too. I've been here on dates and brought parents visiting. Highly recommend.
author: Maria J.

description: I stopped by today to have lunch. I very impressed with the Tandoori Chicken that I had, very tasty and just the right about of heat!!! The service was excellent, the staff did a great job!! I will definitely go back and bring my friends and family to this great place that is hidden in heart of Noe Valley. I know I this is going to do great because they have great food, service and overall not expensive at all!!!!
author: George T.

description: Went there on a Saturday night - seated right away and had great service. The portion sizes are very generous and the food was great- everyone leaves with leftovers. Really enjoyed the gobi manchurian.
author: Roshni J.

description: I love a good baingan bharta. This place has a delicious, craveworthy version. Get it. Also, ordering ahead with, well, Order Ahead was easy.
author: Jyoti U.

description: Awesome to have a good Indian restaurant in the neighborhood. Love the naan, butter chicken, and aloo goobi. Definitely will make it a regular.
author: Peter F.

description: I've been looking for a good take out Indian food place that would deliver to The Castro for seven years and Holy Kitchen is it.  After reading the reviews that the food was tasty but service/delivery could take a while, I decided to take a chance and am SOOOO glad that I did.  Could be that it was okay because I called in the order at 5:40 on an Sunday night, hoping to get the food by 7, but it showed up at our door in about 20 minutes.  Everything we ordered was DELICIOUS!  One thing I really appreciated too is that there were enough smaller/medium sized pieces of  protein (chicken / lamb / cheese) in all of the dishes for everyone to have a good taste VS other places we've ordered from where there's 4 big chunks of meat and the rest is sauce / veg.  So happy to have found Holy Kitchen.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great addition to Noe Valley. The Malabar fish curry was delicious. Friendly staff, Good food, good flavors.  Highly recommended.
author: Ingrid C.

description: I grew-up eating Indian and Pakistani food, and have eaten it all over the Bay Area.  My wife and I were very excited to see the terrible Thai restaurant down the block replaced by Holy Kitchen; unfortunately, Holy Kitchen is a holy mess.  Not only did they keep us waiting 30 minutes for a take-out order that was supposed to be ready in 10 minutes, the food was overpriced and disappointing.  The "Chef's Recommended" Butter Chicken was frankly terrible; while the sauce was flavorful, and they respected my request to prepare it spicy (by Desi standards), the chicken they used in it tasted like it was day-old tandoori chicken drumsticks left over from an earlier buffet.  Rather than tasty chunks of tender chicken breast, the meat was picked off of drums and thighs, and included tough cartilage and gristle--I literally had to spit out my mouthful twice because the chicken cuts were so bad.  Unforgivable, especially at the prices they're charging.
author: Khurshid K.
